comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Captain McClintock was appointed First Deputy Police Commissioner of New York City on February 1, 1914. A New York Times story (December 8, 1914) hinted that his resignation only ten months later was motivated by a desire to accept a police post in the new (and USA-administered) Panama Canal Zone: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9B00E...
